Don Williams served as combat engineer, building bridges for the Allies in Nazi-occupied territories. Williams continued his service until 1946 and later trained as a mechanical engineer: https://www.concordmonitor.com/D-Day-Memorial-Day-Veteran-Profiles-Don-Williams-25758787Â â€¦

Joseph Bennett of Manchester arrived in Normandy 5 days after the Allies began the invasion and was later captured by German soldiers. He escaped and continued to serve until 1945. Today he lives in the Tilton Veterans Home: https://www.concordmonitor.com/D-Day-Memorial-Day-Veteran-Profiles-Joe-Bennett-25758841Â â€¦

Robert Barnard of Concord enlisted in the U.S. Navy on his 17th birthday â€“ 16 months later he would fight on the beaches of Normandy. In June, Robert will be appointed a Chevalier of the Legion of Honor, France's highest honor: https://www.concordmonitor.com/D-Day-Memorial-Day-Veteran-Profiles-Robert-Barnard-25763256Â â€¦

ğŸ‘‰ğŸ¼JOBS Act: This bipartisan bill would help close the skills gap businesses are seeing. It would expand Pell Grant eligibility to cover intense, short-term job training programs aimed at boosting students career opportunities.
